nodes.text: the server would also know the layout algorithm, meaning it would know which nodes were in view, and which weren't, and could respond with the relevant data, as the view expanded or changed
nodes.author: connor

nodes.text: then when you zoom in on a conversation, it could actually literally drop nodes from the rendering, that were far enough out of view
nodes.author: connor

nodes.text: then you would have more of a truly infinite canvas, that could scale to the conversation
nodes.author: connor

nodes.text: The layout algorithm could/would also progressively slow with the overall size though, so there DOES, at some level, need to be distinctions between conversation contexts
nodes.author: connor

nodes.text: Our layout algorithm assumes left-right layout of text, which isn't true for all languages/text.

nodes.text: Something I wrote down in my notes is that dynamic maps are reall just a set of filters.  A static map is one where to specifiy it, you need to add extra metadata that aren't in any of the nodes or edges... i.e. node coordinates.
